headline.main: TRADE PACT IS SET WITH EUROPEANS

docs.snippet: LEAD: Representatives of nearly 100 industrial and developing nations finally agreed today to start important trade-freeing negotiations next month. Their accord came after the United States and France reached an ambiguous compromise on what priority...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Representatives of nearly 100 industrial and developing nations finally agreed today to start important trade-freeing negotiations next month. Their accord came after the United States and France reached an ambiguous compromise on what priority agriculture should have in the talks.

docs.snippet: LEAD: World beef and veal output is expected to fall slightly this year, bringing relief from years of overproduction and improving prospects for a firmer market, the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade has predicted.

docs.snippet: LEAD: WASHINGTON, March 2 - A girl from Westmont, Ill., and a girl from Stuyvesant High School in Manhattan were named the nation's top young scientists tonight in the Westinghouse Science Talent Search, the first time that girls have won the two...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WASHINGTON, March 2 - A girl from Westmont, Ill., and a girl from Stuyvesant High School in Manhattan were named the nation's top young scientists tonight in the Westinghouse Science Talent Search, the first time that girls have won the two highest awards the country's oldest and most prestigious competition for teen-age scientists.
